page.title: 12BLACK COUNTRY ENTERTAINERS
page.content: The Robin Hood Inn on Merry Hill, is home to a group of entertainers whose theme and raison d'etre is life in the Black Country, which they celebrate in song, poetry and humourous tales. Jon Rasen has researched into the music and folklore of the district, and has produced several records and books on the subject, and appeared on radio and TV. Brian Clift, born in Netherton, is a solo artist who sings the songs of the area. Tommy Mundon from Halesowen also heard on radio and TV, concentrates on comedy as does the comediennne Dolly Allen. Harry Harrison, the veteran of the group, has been writing dialect poems , now numbered at over 1000, since 1938. His funny and often thought_provoking poems and tales, heard many times on TV and radio, form an integral part of an evening with the troupe.
